item.title: 长期国债价格波动，交易员静候美国就业数据
item.description: 美国国债价格波动，因投资者正密切关注就业数据以获取利率路径的线索，而大宗商品价格飙升则加剧了对顽固通胀的担忧。【原文：US Treasuries fluctuated as investors looked ahead to jobs data for clues on the path of interest rates and surging commodity prices kindled concerns about sticky inflation.】

item.title: 加拿大顶级企业高管团体质疑卡尼应对特朗普的策略
item.description: 加拿大首席执行官协会负责人质疑马克·卡尼处理与白宫关系的举措，呼吁总理专注于挽救北美贸易协定。【原文：The head of an organization that represents Canadian chief executives questioned Mark Carney’s handling of the relationship with the White House, calling on the prime minister to focus on salvaging the North American trade pact.】

item.title: 美印在果阿能源峰会上商讨扩大煤炭贸易
item.description: 美国和印度官员周四表示，两国正在商讨如何促进煤炭贸易，双方都认为这种燃料对能源安全至关重要。【原文：US and India are in talks to boost the trade of coal, a fuel both nations consider key to energy security, their officials said Thursday.】

item.title: South Africa Holds Key Interest Rate as Inflation Outlook Cools
item.description: 南非央行如预期暂停宽松周期，因通胀前景略有降温。【原文：South Africa’s central bank paused its easing cycle as expected amid a slightly cooler outlook for inflation.】

item.title: BBVA计划推出与70亿欧元资产挂钩的风险转移交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，BBVA SA计划发行两笔重大风险转移交易，涉及约70亿欧元（84亿美元）的资产。【原文：BBVA SA plans to issue two significant risk transfer deals linked to around €7 billion ($8.4 billion) of assets, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 沙特曼纳拉公司就进军金属贸易领域征询企业意见
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯国有金属与矿业公司正与全球多家大型商品交易商洽谈拓展贸易业务，随着该王国在全球供应链中的影响力不断扩大。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s state-controlled metals and mining vehicle is in talks with some of the world’s biggest commodity houses over a push into trading, as the kingdom expands its presence in global supply chains.】

item.title: 罗杰斯财报亮眼，蓝鸟队赛季助推营收增长
item.description: 罗杰斯通讯公司第四季度业绩超出分析师预期，得益于其媒体业务板块的强劲增长以及旗下多伦多蓝鸟棒球队打入世界大赛。【原文：Rogers Communications Inc. beat analysts’ fourth-quarter estimates thanks to strong growth in its media segment and a World Series appearance by its Toronto Blue Jays baseball team.】

item.title: 菲亚特、丰田大亨领投初创企业RobCo，融资额达1亿美元
item.description: 德国初创企业RobCo专注于制造工业机器人，近日获得1亿美元融资，投资方包括菲亚特母公司Stellantis NV和Exor NV背后的家族，以及一位亿万富翁丰田经销商。【原文：RobCo, a German startup that makes robots for use in manufacturing, has raised $100 million in financing from investors including the family behind Fiat parent Stellantis NV and Exor NV, and a billionaire Toyota dealer.】

item.title: 加密货币"数字黄金"神话破灭，交易者转向实物金属
item.description: Bitcoin’s “digital gold” promise is unraveling as traders forgo the token for surging metals, hurting a narrative that once defined the asset’s macro appeal.

item.title: 贝莱德与合伙集团联合推出私人财富管理账户
item.description: 贝莱德集团与合作伙伴集团控股公司共同推出双方合作的首个私募市场投资项目，旨在分得富人手中数万亿美元资产的一杯羹。【原文：BlackRock Inc. and Partners Group Holding AG launched the first joint private-markets investment of their partnership aimed at grabbing a slice of the trillions of dollars sitting in the hands of wealthy individuals.】

item.title: 皇家加勒比股价飙升，需求加速推动船队扩张
item.description: 皇家加勒比邮轮公司股价飙升，因邮轮度假需求持续加速增长，该公司船队规模或将新增多达六艘邮轮。【原文：Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. shares jumped as demand for cruise holidays keeps accelerating, which could see the liner add as many as six additional ships to its fleet.】

item.title: 印度液化天然气买家与全球生产商陷入斗鸡博弈
item.description: 全球范围内正涌现出一波新的燃料供应，但印度买家正等待价格合适时再出手。【原文：There’s a wave of fuel supply coming online around the world, but buyers in India are waiting until the price is right.】

item.title: 美联储意外出现沃勒异议被视为孤注一掷之举
item.description: 我是克里斯·安斯蒂，波士顿资深经济编辑。今天我们将探讨美联储周三一场引发争议的反对票。欢迎将反馈与线索发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。若您尚未订阅本通讯，可点击此处完成注册。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey , a senior economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at a dissenting vote at the Fed Wednesday that raised some eyebrows. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net . And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here .】

item.title: 扎克伯格再次开出装满现金的运钞车
item.description: Meta首席执行官持续增加人工智能领域的投资【原文：Meta’s CEO continues to boost spending for AI】

item.title: 康卡斯特利润超预期，尽管宽带业务下滑
item.description: 康卡斯特公司公布的第四季度营收和利润均达到或超过华尔街预期，尽管该公司仍在持续流失有线电视和互联网用户。【原文：Comcast Corp. reported revenue and profit in the fourth quarter that met or surpassed Wall Street expectations, even as it continued to lose cable TV and internet customers.】

item.title: 押注2026年欧洲央行意外降息可获12倍回报
item.description: 交易员正利用期权押注欧洲央行决策者将在今年某个时候出人意料地宣布降息25个基点。【原文：Traders are using options to bet on European Central Bank policymakers surprising markets by delivering a quarter-point interest-rate cut at some point this year.】

item.title: 乌克兰在巩固战时融资后宣布降息
item.description: 乌克兰央行下调基准利率，结束了近一年来的稳定借贷成本。此前，外国援助的注入和通胀的缓解支撑了这个饱受战争摧残的国家经济。【原文：Ukraine’s central bank cut its benchmark interest rate, ending almost a year of steady borrowing costs after an infusion of foreign aid and easing inflation shored up the country’s war-battered economy.】

item.title: 瑞士对美出口创历史新高，成功抵御特朗普关税冲击
item.description: 阿尔卑斯山共和国去年向美国出口了创纪录的货物量。【原文：The Alpine republic shipped the most goods ever to America last year.】

item.title: 美联储按兵不动后美元企稳，新兴市场资产暂停涨势
item.description: 新兴市场股票和货币基准指数在连续五日上涨后出现停滞，因美联储对降息态度谨慎，而印尼股市遭遇二十年来最严重抛售。【原文：Benchmark indexes for emerging-market stocks and currencies paused after a five-day advance as the Federal Reserve signaled caution on interest-rate cuts and Indonesia’s stock market endured its worst selloff in two decades.】

item.title: 加蓬政府正与世界银行商讨5亿美元贷款事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，加蓬政府正与世界银行就一笔5亿美元贷款进行谈判，以支持该国经济发展。【原文：Gabon’s government is in negotiations with the World Bank for a $500 million loan to support the economy, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 金属狂潮席卷全球投资者
item.description:
今年白银价格上涨64%，因投资者纷纷抛售美元和主权债券。

【原文：

Silver is up 64% this year as investors shift away from the dollar and sovereign bonds.

】

item.title: 卡特彼勒业绩超预期，数据中心带动电力需求增长
item.description: 卡特彼勒公司公布的季度收益超出华尔街预期，因人工智能数据中心对电力需求的激增推动了该公司发电设备的需求。【原文：Caterpillar Inc. posted quarterly earnings that beat Wall Street expectations as soaring electricity needs for artificial intelligence data centers drove demand for the company’s power generation equipment.】

item.title: 欧佩克+将维持暂停增产决定，即便油价触及70美元
item.description: 代表们表示，尽管美国对成员国伊朗的威胁推动油价升至每桶70美元，但欧佩克+目前仍按计划推进本季度最后阶段的减产方案。【原文：OPEC+ currently remains on track to ratify the last part of this quarter’s oil production pause, delegates said, even as US threats against member nation Iran propel prices to $70 a barrel.】

item.title: 包装业巨头国际纸业探索拆分
item.description: 国际纸业公司计划拆分并剥离其欧洲包装业务。【原文：International Paper Co. plans to break up and spin off its European packaging operations.】

item.title: BPCL计划在新加坡设立交易中心以降低成本并提升利润率
item.description: 印度巴拉特石油公司董事长桑杰·卡纳周四表示，这家国有炼油企业将于下月在新加坡开设贸易办事处，旨在提高原料采购流程的灵活性，同时降低成本以提升加工利润率。【原文：India’s Bharat Petroleum Corp. will open a trading office in Singapore next month, as the state-owned refiner seeks to become more flexible in its feedstock procurement process and reduce costs to boost processing margins, Chairman Sanjay Khanna said on Thursday.】

item.title: VSE同意以20亿美元收购Precision Aviation
item.description: VSE公司——一家为航空业提供售后零部件及服务的供应商——已同意以现金加股票交易的方式，以约20.25亿美元收购私营企业精密航空集团。【原文：VSE Corp., a provider of aftermarket parts and services to the aviation industry, agreed to buy closely held Precision Aviation Group for about $2.025 billion in a cash-and-stock deal.】

item.title: MSCI警告后印尼股市陷入"信心危机"
item.description: 就在几天前，印尼股市还处于高位运行。上周基准指数创下收盘新高，万亿市值似乎近在眼前。【原文：Just days ago, Indonesia’s stock market was riding high. The benchmark index hit a record close last week, and a $1 trillion valuation seemed within sight.】

item.title: 冰岛通胀率意外攀升至16个月高点
item.description: 冰岛通胀率意外加速至逾一年来最高水平，这可能令政策制定者对进一步下调西欧最高借贷成本的步伐感到担忧。【原文：Iceland’s inflation surprised by accelerating to its fastest pace in more than a year, likely raising concerns for the policymakers about the pace of further easing of the highest borrowing costs in western Europe.】

item.title: 英国银行通过英格兰银行短期回购工具借款创纪录的1009亿英镑
item.description: 银行从英格兰银行回购协议融资工具借入创纪录金额，表明在央行持续从金融体系抽离过剩流动性的背景下，市场对现金的需求正在增长。【原文：Banks borrowed a record amount from a Bank of England repo facility, signaling growing demand for cash at a time when the central bank continues to drain excess liquidity from the financial system.】

item.title: 劳埃德银行预计2026年人工智能投资将带来1亿英镑收益
item.description: 劳埃德银行集团预计今年将通过运用人工智能获得1亿英镑（约合1.38亿美元）的收益，该银行正持续加大对技术的投入力度。【原文：Lloyds Banking Group Plc expects to see a £100 million ($138 million) benefit from using artificial intelligence this year as the bank continues investing heavily in technology.】
